author: Yaman Agarwal

recipeIntros.text:
Hey Foodies,
This breaded Onion Rings recipe is plain onion rings which are batter fried. They’re extra crunchy thanks to the panko bread crumbs and slightly sweet due to the onion. Delicious on their own, but even better when combined with Mayonnaise or any other dips.Perfect for game nights or parties. So easy and delicious!

recipeNotes:
Notes:
You can replace cornflour with rice flour.
You can also bake these onion rings in a preheated oven at 220°C for 20 minutes.
Panko Breadcrumbs are made with Japanese Bread, it is long in shape compared to regular breadcrumbs.

Tips:
You can coat the onion rings and freeze it for upto one month.
title: How to make Crunchy Onion Rings – Eggless Recipe

steps.text: Slice the onions into rings about 1cm in thickness. Separate the onion into rings. Discard the small and broken parts.
In a large bowl combine corn flour, maida, garlic powder, garlic paste, red chili powder and salt. Mix all the ingredients well.
Add water little at a time to the mixture; keep stirring to form a thick batter consistency. In another bowl put the panko bread crumbs.
Take the onions rings and dip it in the batter and coat it well. Place the coated onion rings in the breadcrumbs and coat it again.
Be quick while doing this step. Continue the same steps for the remaining of the onion rings.

In a deep frying pan, heat the oil on medium flame. Add the onion rings in batches. Deep fry them for 3 minutes or until they are golden brown and crunchy. Follow the same procedure for the remaining onion rings. Remove on a kitchen towel.
Sprinkle some mixed herbs and garnish with chopped coriander. Serve Onion Rings with mayonnaise.
